pr_title: Add a method to CompositeChange to return a flattened version

timeline.message: Add a method to CompositeChange to return a flattened version

timeline.bodyText:
Couple more test cases to consider having:

trivial case where there is a single composite change and the input is the same as output
deeply nested (more than 2) singleton change
timeline.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText: The existing test case already is testing deeply nested changes.  It goes at least 3 deep.
replies.author: trevan

replies.bodyText:
Indeed, I'm drawing a slight distinction:

deeply nested with N+1 changes
deeply nested with just 1 change

In the latter case one would expect that to be flattened into a single change.
replies.author: DanVanAtta

replies.bodyText: @DanVanAtta , I see what you mean.  I've added a test for the later case.
replies.author: trevan

timeline.bodyText: nit: A ternary would be worth consider having here, would make the lambda syntax a bit nicer.
timeline.author: DanVanAtta

timeline.bodyText: Could use a javadoc IMO, particularly considering the method is recursive.
timeline.author: DanVanAtta
